name: Sites Monitor
author: Verdant Studio

sections.description:
Monitor your WordPress websites from a single WordPress installation and keep track of plugin and WordPress version updates, storage, users, maintainers, clients, important notes and so on. You are completely in charge of your data.

How it works

Configure a WordPress website as the receiving party (Monitor) and have your public websites synchronize metrics towards it with an interval of your own choosing. Read our Getting Started guide for more information.

Free Features

  • Track WP version: view the currently installed and latest available WordPress version
  • Track plugin updates: quickly see which plugins are out of date and what their latest version is
  • Track site health: see the general score of the WP Site health
  • Track directory sizes: see the directory sizes of a site, database, uploads and so on
  • Track user count: see how many users a website has
  • Sort and filter: sort and filter the list of sites by name, version, plugin status and site health
  • Toggle features: decide what information to display on the general overview
  • Privacy focused: be in charge of your website’s data, there is no sharing with any third party
  • Unlimited sites! connect as many sites as you want to the data receiving (monitor) site
  • More to come! This is an early version of the plugin, we’re actively improving and adding new features

Premium Features

  • Clients: add clients/organizations to a site for easy recognition
  • Maintainers: add maintainers to a site so that your team knows who is responsible for maintaining the site
  • Search: do you have lots of sites? Search and filter by site name, maintainer, client and so on
  • Notes: keep track of things by adding notes to your sites
  • Premium support: contact us for assistance

Short video introduction
sections.installation:
1. Upload sites-monitor folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
sections.faq:
Where can I find the documentation?

You can find the documentation at: wpsitesmonitor.com/documentation

Does this plugin affect performance?

Sites Monitor only uses a few API’s and sends a minimal amount of data to the site which acts as the monitor. The monitor site itself does not need to fetch or crawl data. You can also configure at what interval the data is synchronized.

My question is not listed here

You can find our complete FAQ at: wpsitesmonitor.com/documentation/faq
